title.narrative: ERT - Draft Guiding Principals on Extreme Poverty and Human Rights

description.narrative: The Draft Guiding Principles is the first international document which clearly sets out the implications of existing international law in relation to the human rights of people living in extreme poverty. The aim of the revised version of the draft Guiding Principles is to facilitate and inform the meaningful application of international human rights standards by practitioners and those working for the elimination of extreme poverty. The Draft Guiding Principles will interpret existing standards and be a practical tool, offering operational guidance to States and other actors. The Draft Guiding Principles will also serve to empower people living in extreme poverty, through reaffirming their rights and providing guidance on concrete means to secure the realisation of those rights.
